text: <extra_id_0> oriP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is essential for EBNA gene promoter activity in Epstein-Barr virus-immortalized lymphoblastoid cell lines .

During Epstein-Barr virus latent infection of B lymphocytes in vitro , six viral nuclear antigens ( EBNAs ) are expressed from one of two promoters , <extra_id_0> Cp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or <extra_id_0> Wp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , whose activities are mutually exclusive .
Upon infection , <extra_id_0> Wp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is initially active , followed by a switch to <extra_id_0> Cp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> for the duration of latency .

text: In this study , the region upstream of <extra_id_0> Cp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was analyzed for the presence of cis elements involved in regulating the activities of the EBNA gene promoters in established in vitro immortalized lymphoblastoid cell lines ( LCLs ) .

It was determined that <extra_id_0> oriP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , the origin for episomal maintenance during latency , is essential for efficient transcription initiation from either <extra_id_0> Cp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or <extra_id_0> Wp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in LCLs , as well as in some Burkitt 's lymphoma cell lines .
Deletion of the <extra_id_0> EBNA2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - dependent enhancer located upstream of <extra_id_0> Cp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> resulted in a ca .
two - to fivefold reduction in <extra_id_0> Cp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activity in the LCLs assayed .

More extensive deletion of sequences upstream of <extra_id_0> Cp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , including the <extra_id_0> EBNA2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - dependent enhancer , resulted in nearly complete loss of <extra_id_0> Cp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activity .

This loss of activity was shown to correlate with deletion of two CCAAT boxes , a proximal CCAAT box located at bp -61 to -65 and a distal CCAAT box located at bp -253 to -257 , upstream of <extra_id_0> Cp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Site - directed mutagenesis of these cis elements demonstrated that <extra_id_0> Cp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activity is highly dependent on the presence of a properly positioned CCAAT box , with the dependence on the distal CCAAT box apparent only when the proximal CCAAT box was deleted or mutated .

text: Deletion of the glucocorticoid response elements located at ca .

In general , deletions which diminished <extra_id_0> Cp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activity resulted in induction of <extra_id_0> Wp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activity , consistent with suppression of <extra_id_0> Wp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activity by transcriptional interference from <extra_id_0> Cp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
